div1.head: Military Orders for Rafael T. Echeverria, April 26, 1900
div1.p:
ORDERS, BOOKS, BLANKS & D.C. DIV.
A. G. O.
RECD. MAY 7 1900

FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Vol 175 A 1900

HEADQUARTERS DIVISION OF CUBA,
Havana, April 26, 1900.

1. Upon the recommendation of the Chief Surgeon of the
Division, Major R. Echeverria, Surgeon, U. S. Volunteers,
will in addition to his present duties attend the Quarter-
master's employes stationed in the city of Havana under
such instructions as may be given him by the Chief Surgeon
of the Division.
↓

The Quartermaster's Department will furnish Major
Echeverria such transportation as is necessary in the per-
formance of this duty.

2. Recruit Walter F. Jennings, battery M, 2d U. S. Artil-
lery, having been tried by a general court-martial convened
at Santa Clara Battery, Havana, Cuba, and found guilty of
selling clothing in violation of the 17th Article of War, and
absence without leave in violation of the 32d Article of War,
was sentenced “To forfeit ten (10) dollars of his pay per month
for a period of three (3) months.”

The sentence is confirmed and will be duly executed.
Recruit Jennings will be released from confinement and re-
stored to duty with his battery.

3. Captain Everett E. Benjamin, 1st Infantry, having re-
ported at these Headquarters in compliance with paragraph
2. Special Orders No. 83, current series, Headquarters De-
partment of the East, will proceed to join his proper station,
Guanajay, Cuba.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

4. Private Edward K. Monks, company M, 1st Infantry,
having reported at these Headquarters without means to
join his proper station, the Quartermaster's Department
will furnish him the necessary transportation from this city
to the station of his company, Guanajay, Cuba, the cost
of which will be reported to his company commander in or-
der that the same may be charged against the soldier on the
next muster and pay roll of his company.
BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL WOOD:
